intro: Stenocalyx strigosus, commonly known as the hairy stenocalyx, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and hairy foliage. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
